dt: {bc}a polished or smooth surface (as of glass) that forms images by reflection

dt.t: She looked at herself in the {wi}mirror{/wi}.
the press as a {wi}mirror{/wi} of public opinion
She is the {wi}mirror{/wi} of feminine beauty.

et: Middle English {it}mirour{/it} "object with a reflective surface, reflection, model of conduct," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}mirur, mireour,{/it} from {it}mirer{/it} "to look at" (going back to Latin {it}mīrārī{/it} "to be surprised, look with wonder at") + {it}-ur, -eour{/it} {et_link|-or:1|-or:1} {ma}{mat|admire|admire}{/ma}
shortdef: a polished or smooth surface (as of glass) that forms images by reflection
something that gives a true representation

dt: {bc}to reflect in or as if in a mirror

shortdef: to reflect in or as if in a mirror
